stories.title: Shopping Looking Phrase
stories.text: When you enter a shop, you might say, "I'm just looking." This means you are browsing, not buying. The shopkeeper may ask if you need help, and you can reply politely.

stories.title: Looking For Expressions
stories.text: When I was in the city, I was looking for a quiet café. I asked the locals, and they directed me to a small place on the corner. I found it and enjoyed a cup of coffee.

stories.title: Rain Weather Contrast
stories.text: The city has been experiencing heavy rain for the past week. Despite the continuous downpour, the temperature remains high, making the streets humid and uncomfortable. Residents are hoping that the weather will improve soon. A cidade tem enfrentado chuva forte na última semana.

stories.title: Despite Contrast Preposition
stories.text: Despite the heavy traffic, Maria arrived at the meeting on time. She had planned her route carefully and left early. Despite being nervous, she spoke confidently and impressed everyone.

stories.title: Despite Out Of Money
stories.text: Despite being out of money, Maria decided to travel to Lisbon at the end of the year. She saved every penny she could and found cheap flights. Meanwhile, her friend João bought a call option on a tech stock, but it remained out of the money because the price dropped.

stories.title: No Money Despite Although
stories.text: Maria had no money, but she still wanted to buy a new book. Despite having no money, she decided to borrow it from a friend. Although it was expensive, she thought it was worth the effort. Maria não tinha dinheiro, mas ainda queria comprar um livro novo.

stories.title: Death Die Passed Away
stories.text: When we talk about death, we often use words that are gentle and respectful. In English, we say "die" for a general statement, and we use the phrase "passed away" when we want to be more polite. For example, a doctor might say, "The patient passed away last night," while a friend might simply say, "He died at 70." Understanding these differences helps us communicate with sensitivity.

stories.title: Worth Expressions
stories.text: When deciding whether to take on a new project, consider if it's worth the effort. Even if the task seems difficult, the potential benefits can outweigh the challenges. Ao decidir se deve assumir um novo projeto, considere se vale a pena o esforço.

stories.title: Shopping Eco Friendly
stories.text: My wife likes to buy clothes at the local mall. She prefers eco-friendly fabrics because she cares about the environment. Every month she finds new styles that are both fashionable and sustainable. Minha esposa gosta de comprar roupas no shopping local.

stories.title: Dev Workflow Terms
stories.text: Last Friday, I worked on mapping Zoho and TR statuses. Vinicus pushed the PR to the development environment, and after pushing, I performed tests. Everything works well. Now, I'm refining the code, and the next step is to add variant statuses. Na última sexta-feira, eu trabalhei em mapear os status do Zoho e do TR. Vinicus enviou o PR para o ambiente de desenvolvimento, e depois de enviar, realizei testes. Tudo funciona bem. Agora, estou aperfeiçoando o código, e o próximo passo é adicionar estados variantes.

stories.title: Comparisons Faraway Sample
stories.text: I have created my own study process and I am studying with him for 30 minutes a day. We use a sample handout in PDF to practice. Many studies show that almost everyone improves wellIbeing when they compare their progress. Everything else is optional, but far away goals are still within reach.

stories.title: Cheapest Maybe Intent
stories.text: I intend to study with him partially, but I will also attend the class alone. Maybe we can meet after class to review the material. The cheapest option for a study group is to use the library, which is free.

stories.title: Contract Intention
stories.text: My contract with Aliança was for 3 months, but I intend to renew. My contract with KNN is for 2 years and I will continue this study. I want to have extra classes with a teacher outside of Aliança. For a while I only think about it, and I keep thinking about how to improve my skills. Meu contrato com a Aliança durava três meses, mas eu pretendo renováIlo. Meu contrato com a KNN tem 2 anos e eu continuarei este estudo.

stories.title: Weekend Travel Conferences
stories.text: Last weekend I went to Águas de Lidoia with my wife. We also attended a couple of conferences. It was raining a lot there, but the event was very good despite the rain. I spent precious time with my wife and we had a wonderful picnic. No fim de semana passado eu fui à Águas de Lidoia com minha esposa. Também participamos de algumas conferências.

stories.title: Expressions And Phrases
stories.text: When I first visited the city, I thought I would never again feel so lost. The streets were confusing, and I couldn’t find my way. I told my friend, "It isn’t for you; I can’t tell you that you’re using the word ‘intent’ and pretending correctly now." He laughed and said, "No more worries, we’ll get there together." Quando visitei a cidade pela primeira vez, achei que nunca mais me sentiria tão perdido. As ruas eram confusas e eu não conseguia encontrar meu caminho.

stories.title: Might Maybe Later Concern
stories.text: During the meeting, the manager said, "The last one might be a later concern," and everyone nodded. Later, a colleague added, "Maybe we should focus on the main task first." The team decided to postpone the discussion about the last item until next week.

stories.title: Time Expressions For When Soon
stories.text: I have a meeting tomorrow. I will call you soon. Use this for when you’re tired. It was too soon to leave the office early.

stories.title: Verb Tenses And Expressions
stories.text: She stands at the podium and says, ‘Good luck to everyone.’ I knew the answer to the question, but I was bitten by a stray dog earlier. They are tired after the long walk, so they decided to take a short nap. I enjoy writing stories and sometimes whistle quietly while I write.

stories.title: Affordable Expensive Vocab
stories.text: Many people look for affordable options when traveling. However, some destinations offer expensive experiences that are worth the cost. Choosing between unaffordable and expensive can be challenging, especially when budgets are tight. Muitas pessoas procuram opções acessíveis quando viajam. No entanto, alguns destinos oferecem experiências caras que valem o custo. Escolher entre inadquível e caro pode ser desafiador, especialmente quando o orçamento é apertado.

stories.title: Fashion Confidence Vocab
stories.text: Maria loves fashion. Every morning she chooses an outfit that makes her look stylish. She proudly shows her new clothes to her friends. However, she knows that wearing too many accessories can be compromising if she forgets to check her safety. She always balances style with safety. Maria ama moda. Todas as manhãs, ela escolhe um conjunto que a faz parecer elegante.

stories.title: Business Work Vocabulary
stories.text: During the product launch, the team’s responsiveness impressed everyone. They worked properly and were ready for demo. The next step was to finalize handling of non-user-facing statuses. After the rollout, we confirmed stability after recent deployment. It was almost finished, but we realized it was too soon to announce the release.

stories.title: Greatly Enhance Vocab
stories.text: In today's fast-paced world, tools that greatly enhance learning are in high demand. Companies invest in software that can greatly enhance employee productivity, leading to better results and happier teams. No mundo acelerado de hoje, ferramentas que aumentam muito o aprendizado são muito procuradas. As empresas investem em softwares que podem melhorar muito a produtividade dos funcionários, resultando em melhores resultados e equipes mais felizes.

stories.title: Expressions Intensity And Praise
stories.text: When I saw the new puppy, I said, "That's cute!" The owner smiled and said, "Yes, it's very cute. I think that's smart to keep it indoors during the night." I nodded, feeling that much more confident about pet care.

stories.title: Earns Businesswork General
stories.text: Many people work hard to earn a living. Some earn a living by selling products, while others earn a living by providing services. The amount you earn depends on your skills, experience, and the effort you put in. Muitas pessoas trabalham duro para ganhar a vida. Algumas ganham a vida vendendo produtos, enquanto outras ganham a vida oferecendo serviços. O valor que você ganha depende de suas habilidades, experiência e do esforço que você dedica.

stories.title: Phrasal Verbs Live Look
stories.text: I live on sponsorship, so I can focus on my art. Parently, the gallery is open, and apparently everyone loves the new exhibition. I am looking at the painting on the wall, and it inspires me.

stories.title: Business Work General Vocab
stories.text: During the meeting, I gave a brief introduction explaining what is expected in the flow. I split my screen to make it easier to view changes on both platforms. On one side we have a Zoho display, and on the other side we have the Theft Portal. I will create a new thread on the theft portal to report it. It should be displayed on Zoho, and after that, I will change the statuses in Zoho. Some things still need to be adjusted, but it is working as expected.

stories.title: Awesome Expressions
stories.text: At the new art gallery, the exhibition was truly awesome. Visitors said, "It looks awesome," and many were glad they liked it. The curator, excited, said, "I'm really happy to hear that you enjoyed the show. The pieces are really nice and so cool that it works, especially the interactive installation." Everyone left with smiles. Na nova galeria de arte, a exposição foi realmente incrível. Os visitantes disseram: "Parece incrível", e muitos ficaram felizes por terem gostado. O curador, animado, disse: "Estou realmente feliz em saber que você gostou da mostra. As peças são muito boas e tão legais que funcionam, especialmente a instalação interativa." Todos saíram com sorrisos.

stories.title: Pity Math Sick Instead
stories.text: Yesterday, I was sick one day and slept. When I woke up, I saw my sticker collection on the fridge. I admired how she makes math look easy, but I still felt pity for the stray dog outside. Instead of going out, I stayed home and read about shiny coins and fruit-shaped toys. He has over 500 books in his library, and he likes the way the city lights twinkle at night. They almost look real, but I doubt their authenticity. Ontem, eu fiquei doente um dia e dormi.

stories.title: Do Not Feel Sorry Prefer Asking
stories.text: When you face a difficult situation, remember: Do not feel sorry for the mistake. Instead, learn from it. I prefer that you keep asking them for guidance, because their experience will help you grow.

stories.title: Quantifiers And May Confuse
stories.text: When learning English, students often encounter words that can be confusing. For example, the word 'bank' can refer to a financial institution or the side of a river. Using quantifiers correctly helps avoid misunderstandings. 'Some' is used for an indefinite amount, 'few' indicates a small number, and 'a couple' means exactly two. Ao aprender inglês, os estudantes frequentemente encontram palavras que podem ser confusas. Por exemplo, a palavra 'bank' pode se referir a uma instituição financeira ou à margem de um rio. Usar quantificadores corretamente ajuda a evitar mal-entendidos. 'Some' é usado para uma quantidade indefinida, 'few' indica um pequeno número, e 'a couple' significa exatamente dois.

stories.title: Business Work General Vocab
stories.text: During the audit, I noted some necessary changes and also some errors in the mapping. The team discussed these points and planned corrective actions.

stories.title: Modal Verbs Concerns
stories.text: When learning English, it is helpful to practice modal verbs. For example, you can say 'Maybe we can go to the park' or 'Can we do it together'. These phrases show how to ask for permission or suggest an action. Remember that modal verbs do not change with the subject, so 'I can', 'you can', 'they can' all use the same form. Ao aprender inglês, é útil praticar verbos modais. Por exemplo, você pode dizer 'Talvez possamos ir ao parque' ou 'Podemos fazer isso juntos'. Essas frases mostram como pedir permissão ou sugerir uma ação. Lembre-se de que os verbos modais não mudam com o sujeito, então 'eu posso', 'você pode', 'eles podem' usam a mesma forma.

stories.title: Reschedule Meeting
stories.text: During the conference, the organizer announced that the keynote speaker would be delayed. "We will need to reschedule the session," she said. Everyone understood that the new time would be announced later.

stories.title: Even Despite Expressions
stories.text: Even with a small budget, the team managed to finish the project on time. Despite the rain, we went out for a walk. Even with the rain, the picnic went ahead as planned.

stories.title: Dismisses Concerns Business
stories.text: During the meeting, the manager dismissed the concerns of the team. He said the issues were minor and would be addressed later, maybe for later consideration.

stories.title: Rock And Standup Terms
stories.text: During the standup time, the team discussed how they were already rocking their new project. Even with a bad day, they stayed motivated, believing that their hard work would pay off. The manager praised them, saying they truly inspired everyone.

stories.title: Grammar Wonder Whether Vs If
stories.text: When you are curious, you can say 'I wonder...'. For example, 'I wonder if the train is on time.' The word 'whether' is used to show a choice, like 'whether to stay or leave.' In contrast, 'if' is used for conditions, e.g., 'If it rains, we stay inside.' Quando você está curioso, pode dizer 'I wonder...'. Por exemplo, 'I wonder if the train is on time.' A palavra 'whether' é usada para mostrar uma escolha, como 'whether to stay or leave'. Em contraste, 'if' é usado para condições, por exemplo, 'If it rains, we stay inside.'

stories.title: Future Tense Going To
stories.text: You are going to update the software tomorrow. When you update, the system will restart automatically. Remember to ask, "When are you going to update the documentation?" before the meeting. Você vai atualizar o software amanhã.

stories.title: Past Tenses And Questions
stories.text: Yesterday, I was going to do my homework, but I decided to play outside instead. I didn't see the related steps there, so I had to ask for help. Later, I learned that the FAQs will cover all steps, which made me feel more confident. Ontem, eu ia fazer minha lição de casa, mas decidi brincar lá fora em vez disso.

stories.title: Expressions And Concerns
stories.text: I was thinking about whether it is worth trying to learn a new language. Even if it seems difficult at first, I know that soon I will feel more confident. I worry about the time I will spend, but my concern for personal growth keeps me motivated. Later concern will be about how to use the language in real life.

stories.title: Worth It Expensive Wonder
stories.text: When deciding to buy a new phone, many people ask themselves, "Is it worth it even if it's expensive?" Some also wonder whether the latest features will improve their daily life. These questions help them weigh cost against benefit. Ao decidir comprar um novo telefone, muitas pessoas se perguntam: "Vale a pena mesmo se for caro?" Algumas também se perguntam se os novos recursos melhorarão sua vida diária. Essas perguntas ajudam a pesar o custo contra o benefício.

stories.title: Smart Enough And Achieve
stories.text: Even though it was raining, Maria decided to go to the library. She was smart enough to finish her homework before the deadline. She needed to grasp the concept of fractions, so she practiced with worksheets. Unless the weather improves, she will stay home. She hopes to achieve this goal of mastering math by the end of the semester.

stories.title: Even Vs Despite
stories.text: It was raining all day, but the city’s marathon went on. Even with the rain, runners kept their pace. Some even shouted, "We’re not giving up!" Despite the heavy downpour, the crowd cheered louder than ever.

stories.title: Seen Hadnt Pretty Past
stories.text: Yesterday, I saw a pretty bird flying near the riverbank. I had never seen such a beautiful sight before. I was pretty excited about the experience and I shared it with my friends. Ontem, eu vi um pássaro bonito voando perto da margem do rio.

stories.title: Amazed Me
stories.text: The night sky lit up with fireworks, each burst brighter than the last. Children ran around, eyes wide, as the colors painted the darkness. The crowd cheered, and the sound of explosions echoed through the streets. It was a moment that amazed everyone, a memory that would last forever. O céu noturno se iluminou com fogos de artifício, cada explosão mais brilhante que a anterior. Crianças correndo, olhos arregalados, enquanto as cores pintavam a escuridão. A multidão aplaudia, e o som das explosões ecoava pelas ruas.

stories.title: Cheerful Adjective Emotions
stories.text: It was a cheerful morning. The sun shone brightly, and the birds sang a lively tune. People walked down the street with smiles on their faces, ready to start the day. Even the coffee shop owner greeted everyone with a cheerful hello, making the whole town feel warm and happy.

stories.title: For A While Vocabulary
stories.text: I have been here for a while, waiting for the bus. It’s the coldest place I’ve been for a while, and I can’t keep my gloves on. I will wait for a while longer before I decide to go home.

stories.title: Cheering Chilling Breezes
stories.text: On a sunny afternoon, a cheering breeze swept across the meadow, lifting the spirits of everyone who walked through it. Nearby, a chilling breeze from the lake brought a refreshing coolness that made the day feel like a gentle vacation. Even the thrilling breeze that danced among the trees added a touch of excitement to the peaceful scene. Em uma tarde ensolarada, uma brisa alegre varreu o prado, elevando o espírito de todos que passavam por ali. Perto, uma brisa refrescante do lago trouxe um frescor que fez o dia parecer uma leve férias. Até a brisa emocionante que dançava entre as árvores adicionou um toque de entusiasmo à cena pacífica.

stories.title: In A While
stories.text: When you are waiting for a friend, you might say, 'I will be ready in a while.' This shows that you expect to finish soon and can start the next activity.

stories.title: Not Even In
stories.text: I have never been to the city, not even in the suburbs. Even in Brazil, the festival is rare.

stories.title: Have You Ever Expressions
stories.text: Have you ever wondered why people travel? Many people ask, 'Have you ever been to a foreign country?' They share stories about their adventures. Some say, 'Have you ever tried local food?' These questions help us learn about experiences. Você já se perguntou por que as pessoas viajam? Muitas pessoas perguntam: 'Você já esteve em um país estrangeiro?' Elas compartilham histórias sobre suas aventuras. Algumas dizem: 'Você já experimentou comida local?' Essas perguntas nos ajudam a aprender sobre experiências.

stories.title: Celebrate Holiday Christmas
stories.text: Every year, families around the world celebrate Christmas. They decorate trees, exchange gifts, and share meals. Celebrating holidays brings joy and togetherness. Todo ano, famílias ao redor do mundo celebram o Natal. Elas decoram árvores, trocam presentes e compartilham refeições. Celebrar feriados traz alegria e união.

stories.title: Expressions Daily Conversation
stories.text: When you meet someone new, it's common to say 'Hello, how are you?' They might reply 'I'm fine, thank you.' You can respond with 'Great!' Quando você encontra alguém novo, é comum dizer 'Olá, como vai?' Eles podem responder 'Estou bem, obrigado.' Você pode responder com 'Ótimo!'

stories.title: Out Loud Expressions
stories.text: Saying words out loud helps you remember them better. When you practice speaking out loud, you notice mistakes and correct them quickly. Try reading a short paragraph aloud every day. Dizer palavras em voz alta ajuda a lembrá-las melhor.

stories.title: Daily Routine Expressions
stories.text: Lately, I've been learning about chunks. Whenever I can, I practice them by the end of the day. Most of my days are busy, but I spend most of my time studying. By the end of the day, I review what I've learned. Últimamente, tenho aprendido sobre chunks. Sempre que posso, pratico-os até o fim do dia. A maioria dos meus dias é ocupada, mas gasto a maior parte do meu tempo estudando. Até o fim do dia, reviso o que aprendi.

stories.title: Parking Area One Way Street
stories.text: When you arrive at the city center, you will notice that most streets are oneIway. This helps traffic flow smoothly. However, you must be careful not to park on a oneIway street, as it is illegal and can result in a fine. Look for a parking area nearby; many malls have large, covered parking areas with electric charging stations.

stories.title: Not Even Expressions
stories.text: I didn't have not even a penny when I left the house. She couldn't find not even a single clue in the mysterious note. They left the house without not even checking the front door.

stories.title: As As Comparisons
stories.text: In English, we often use 'as ... as' to compare two things. For example, 'The cat is as quiet as a mouse.' This structure helps us express equality without implying superiority or inferiority. Em inglês, usamos frequentemente 'as ... as' para comparar duas coisas. Por exemplo, 'O gato é tão quieto quanto um rato.' Essa estrutura ajuda a expressar igualdade sem implicar superioridade ou inferioridade.

stories.title: Thanks Expressions Grammar
stories.text: When you want to show appreciation, you can say thanks or thank you. In a workplace, a simple thank you can build good relationships. In everyday life, saying thanks to a friend or a stranger can make the world a little brighter.

stories.title: Future Simple And Just Today
stories.text: I will do it today because the deadline is tomorrow. She said she would finish the project just today, and we all agreed to review it by the end of the week.

stories.title: So Vs Then Grammar
stories.text: When planning a trip, you might say, 'I will book the flight, so I can arrive early. Then I will check into the hotel.' This shows how 'so' connects a reason to an outcome, while 'then' shows the next step in time. Ao planejar uma viagem, você pode dizer: 'Eu vou reservar o voo, então posso chegar cedo. Depois, eu vou fazer o check-in no hotel.' Isso mostra como 'so' conecta uma razão a um resultado, enquanto 'then' mostra o próximo passo no tempo.

stories.title: Conditional If When
stories.text: If it rains tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic. When it is sunny, we like to go to the beach. Use the umbrella when it rains to stay dry. Se chover amanhã, cancelaremos o piquenique.

stories.title: Confirm Understanding Quick Recap
stories.text: During the weekly project meeting, the team leader asked everyone to confirm their understanding of the new deadlines. After a brief discussion, she gave a quick recap of the action items to ensure everyone was on the same page.

stories.title: Align Terms Business
stories.text: In business, aligning strategies with company goals is essential. Teams must align their plans with budgets and timelines to succeed. No mundo dos negócios, alinhar estratégias com os objetivos da empresa é essencial. As equipes devem alinhar seus planos com orçamentos e cronogramas para ter sucesso.

stories.title: Issue Alignment Business
stories.text: In a busy office, the manager noticed an issue with the new software. She decided to align the issue with the IT team’s schedule to avoid delays. By aligning the issue early, the project stayed on track and the budget was not affected. Em um escritório movimentado, o gerente percebeu um problema com o novo software.

stories.title: Discuss Talk It
stories.text: In many meetings, people are asked to discuss the new project plan. Some prefer to talk about it informally before the official presentation. The key is to listen, ask questions, and share ideas. Em muitas reuniões, as pessoas são solicitadas a discutir o novo plano de projeto. Alguns preferem falar sobre isso informalmente antes da apresentação oficial. A chave é ouvir, fazer perguntas e compartilhar ideias.

stories.title: Daily Routine Expressions
stories.text: Today I have a busy schedule. It's my turn for today to lead the team meeting. After that, it's my goal for today to finish the report. When I need a break, I say Be right back. Hoje tenho uma agenda cheia. É minha vez hoje de liderar a reunião da equipe. Depois disso, meu objetivo para hoje é terminar o relatório.

stories.title: Modal Passive Concerns
stories.text: During the meeting, the manager said that a new policy may be created if the council gathers enough support. He added that some ideas might be considered later, maybe for later consideration, to keep the discussion open.

stories.title: Theatre And Travel Vocab
stories.text: During the evening performance, the actor forgot his line and had to improvise. After the show, he went to the Lost and Found Center to return a lost ticket.

stories.title: Scared Emotions
stories.text: When the lights went out, Maria felt a sudden wave of fear. She was scared of the dark and the noises that echoed through the empty house. She decided to stay in the living room, holding a flashlight, and whispered to herself that she would be okay.

stories.title: Expressions Additional Concordance
stories.text: I like coffee as well. Me too, I enjoy it every morning.

stories.title: Bootstrap Web Design
stories.text: Bootstrap is a free, openIsource toolkit that helps developers create responsive websites quickly. It includes preIdesigned components, a grid system, and JavaScript plugins. By using Bootstrap, you can avoid writing complex CSS from scratch and focus on building features. Bootstrap é um kit de ferramentas gratuito e de código aberto que ajuda os desenvolvedores a criar sites responsivos rapidamente.

stories.title: From Scratch Expressions
stories.text: Starting from scratch can be challenging, but it also gives you full control over the process. Whether you are cooking a meal, building a website, or learning a new skill, doing it from scratch allows you to understand every step. Começar do zero pode ser desafiador, mas também lhe dá controle total sobre o processo. Seja cozinhando uma refeição, construindo um site ou aprendendo uma nova habilidade, fazer isso do zero permite que você compreenda cada etapa.

stories.title: Small Talk General Vocabulary
stories.text: Small talk is a useful skill in many social situations. Whether you are at a party, in a meeting, or on a flight, a few friendly words can help you feel more comfortable and connect with others. Try to ask simple questions about the weather, hobbies, or recent events. Remember, the goal is to keep the conversation light and positive. Small talk é uma habilidade útil em muitas situações sociais. Seja em uma festa, em uma reunião ou em um voo, algumas palavras amigáveis podem ajudar a se sentir mais confortável e a se conectar com os outros. Tente fazer perguntas simples sobre o tempo, hobbies ou eventos recentes. Lembre-se, o objetivo é manter a conversa leve e positiva.

stories.title: Carefully Roof Damage
stories.text: When you open the door carefully, you avoid accidents. The roof of the house was damaged by the storm, causing damage to the interior. To prevent further damage, we installed a new roof and placed a carpet near the stairs so that no one would fall.

stories.title: Summarily Adverb
stories.text: During the meeting, the manager asked everyone to give a summarily report. Each team member spoke briefly, highlighting only the main points. The manager appreciated the concise style and thanked everyone for their efficient summaries.

stories.title: Answer And Talked
stories.text: When I asked the teacher for help, she gave me a clear answer. He didn't know the answer at first, but after a quick conversation, he understood. I talked to him about it, and we solved the problem together. Later, I talked to him about this one, and he offered to help me with the next project.

stories.title: Reason Attending Vocab
stories.text: What is the reason that our company needs to adopt new technology? We have a reason: to stay competitive. I am attending the seminar to learn more about it. Qual é a razão pela qual nossa empresa precisa adotar nova tecnologia? Temos uma razão: permanecer competitiva.

stories.title: Anything Abandoned Warehouse
stories.text: The abandoned warehouse was quiet and dusty. A few workers had come to clean it up. They found old boxes and a broken sign. Even though it was empty, the place felt alive with memories. O armazém abandonado estava quieto e cheio de poeira. Alguns trabalhadores vieram para limpar. Eles encontraram caixas antigas e um letreiro quebrado.

stories.title: Beach Pastor Walkalong
stories.text: I am at the beach with my pastor. We walk along the shore and talk about faith. The sun shines, and the waves crash softly. It is a peaceful moment.

stories.title: Pastor Talking Upcoming
stories.text: My pastor and I are talking about the upcoming charity event tonight. We are excited because the upcoming concert will be held next Saturday. Meu pastor e eu estamos conversando sobre o evento de caridade que acontecerá esta noite. Estamos empolgados porque o concerto que está por vir será realizado no próximo sábado.

stories.title: Painkillers Surgery Injury
stories.text: After a minor injury during a soccer match, Maria went to the clinic. The doctor examined her and prescribed painkillers to relieve the pain. She also advised her to rest and avoid strenuous activity. Maria followed the instructions and recovered quickly. Depois de uma lesão menor durante uma partida de futebol, Maria foi à clínica. O médico a examinou e prescreveu analgésicos para aliviar a dor.

stories.title: Soon Expressions
stories.text: Soon is a versatile adverb that can describe events happening in the near future. For example, you might say, 'I will finish my homework soon.' It can also be used in idiomatic expressions like 'too soon,' which warns that something is happening earlier than expected. Understanding these subtle differences helps you sound natural in everyday conversations. Soon é um advérbio versátil que pode descrever eventos que acontecem no futuro próximo. Por exemplo, você pode dizer: 'Eu terminarei a lição de casa em breve.' Ele também pode ser usado em expressões idiomáticas como 'too soon', que alerta que algo está acontecendo mais cedo do que o esperado. Entender essas sutis diferenças ajuda você a soar natural em conversas cotidianas.

stories.title: My Christmas Travel Weather
stories.text: During the holiday, I shared gifts and memories on My Christmas with family. My Christmas was good, even though there were a few people at home. I went to Campos do Jordão with my family and friends, and we had many memorable moments. It was nice there, even though it hasn't been as cold as expected. After one, we came to our home. My mom came here with my brother and his girlfriend. We went to the beach. Yesterday, it was a sunny day. Those were some good times, indeed.

stories.title: About My Christmas Travel
stories.text: I went to Campos do Jordão; it is quite hot, but I would like it to be cold there. After the trip, I told my friends about my Christmas traditions. We managed to finish the preparations on time, and I managed to keep the whole family happy.

stories.title: Failure And Success Terms
stories.text: In many businesses, failure is seen as a stepping stone to success. Companies that analyze their failures learn valuable lessons and improve their strategies. By acknowledging mistakes openly, teams can innovate faster and avoid repeating the same errors. Em muitas empresas, a falha é vista como um degrau para o sucesso. As empresas que analisam suas falhas aprendem lições valiosas e aprimoram suas estratégias. Ao reconhecer os erros abertamente, as equipes podem inovar mais rapidamente e evitar repetir os mesmos erros.

stories.title: Statues Games Gems Ring
stories.text: In the city park, statues of famous heroes stand proudly on the hill. Nearby, children gather to play games, from board games to video games. A small shop sells precious gems, and a bell rings whenever a customer enters. The atmosphere is lively, and everyone feels that the day is so good. No parque da cidade, estátuas de heróis famosos ficam orgulhosamente no alto da colina. Perto, crianças se reúnem para jogar jogos, desde jogos de tabuleiro até videogames. Uma pequena loja vende gemas preciosas, e um sino toca sempre que um cliente entra. A atmosfera é animada, e todos sentem que o dia é tão bom.

stories.title: Sunset Sunrise Sunshine
stories.text: The morning was bright. The sun rose slowly, painting the sky with pink and orange hues. As the day progressed, the weather stayed sunny, and the gentle breeze carried the scent of blooming flowers. A manhã estava brilhante. O sol nasceu lentamente, pintando o céu com tons de rosa e laranja. À medida que o dia avançava, o clima permanecia ensolarado, e a brisa suave carregava o perfume das flores em flor.

stories.title: The Teeth Chunk Expressions
stories.text: The teacher gave us a chunk of information. On the whole, the lesson was tough, but we learned a new chunk of language. I brush my teeth after school. O professor nos deu um pedaço de informação. No geral, a aula foi difícil, mas aprendemos um novo pedaço de linguagem.

stories.title: General Vocabulary Expressions
stories.text: I think so, yet I also started reading novels to expand my vocabulary. She has not finished yet, but she will finish soon. That’s fine, we can wait. The headline was misleading, but the deeper meaning was clear.

stories.title: Prefer Hiking Expressions
stories.text: When planning a weekend, I prefer hiking to driving because it keeps me active. Some people prefer coffee over tea in the morning. Others say that hiking is better than staying indoors during the rainy season. Ao planejar um fim de semana, eu prefiro fazer trilhas a dirigir porque me mantém ativo. Algumas pessoas preferem café a chá de manhã. Outros dizem que fazer trilhas é melhor do que ficar em casa durante a estação chuvosa.

stories.title: I Worked There Last Year
stories.text: I worked there last year, and it was a valuable experience. I learned teamwork, improved my communication skills, and gained confidence.

stories.title: Hold Safer Security
stories.text: I keep my phone with me at all times. I hold a small flashlight because I feel safer when walking at night. The security guard checks the cameras to keep the building safe.

stories.title: Let You Know Expressions
stories.text: I will let you know if there are any changes to the schedule. Let me know if you need any help. Thanks for letting me know about the new meeting time.

stories.title: Get Back To You Business
stories.text: Subject: Follow-up on the project proposal Hi Maria, Thank you for sending the draft of the project proposal. I have reviewed the main points and will get back to you with detailed feedback by Friday. If you have any questions in the meantime, feel free to reach out. Best regards, John Assunto: Retorno sobre a proposta do projeto Oi Maria, Obrigado por enviar o rascunho da proposta do projeto.

stories.title: Traffic Jam Faster Way
stories.text: During the busy morning, the traffic jam on the highway caused many drivers to be late. I decided to take a different route, and it was faster this way. Arriving on time, I could attend the meeting without stress.

stories.title: Expressions Agreement
stories.text: When planning a trip, people often need to confirm details. "The flight leaves at 8 a.m., I think so, yes," said Maria. She was sure the schedule was correct. Later, her friend added, "We should bring snacks, I think so, yes, it will be helpful." They both felt confident about their preparations. Ao planejar uma viagem, as pessoas costumam confirmar detalhes. "O voo sai às 8h, eu acho que sim," disse Maria.

stories.title: Polite Requests
stories.text: During the meeting, Maria asked, ‘Would you mind repeating the last point?’ The manager nodded and said, ‘Sure, so I can confirm I understand correctly.’ They both felt more confident about the project.

stories.title: Expressões Concerto
stories.text: During the planning meeting, Maria suggested a new schedule. John replied, ‘That sounds good.’ Later, they decided to meet at the café. Maria said, ‘That works for me.’ She added, ‘I will bring a notebook to keep notes.’ Durante a reunião de planejamento, Maria sugeriu um novo cronograma. John respondeu, ‘Isso parece bem.’ Mais tarde, decidiram se encontrar no café. Maria disse, ‘Isso funciona para mim.’ Ela acrescentou, ‘Eu trarei um caderno para fazer anotações.’

stories.title: Cause Effect And Delay
stories.text: The train was delayed because of a technical fault. As a result, many passengers missed their connections. The station announced that the delay would last about an hour. O trem estava atrasado por causa de um problema técnico. Como resultado, muitos passageiros perderam suas conexões. A estação anunciou que o atraso duraria cerca de uma hora.

stories.title: Lead Outcome Terms
stories.text: During the project, several changes were made. The team decided to adopt a new strategy. It led to a different outcome, which surprised everyone. The outcome was better than expected.

stories.title: Work Experience And Regret
stories.text: During the project review, Maria said, “I’ve already done this before, so I know the steps.” Her colleague replied, “I’ve worked on similar projects, so I can help.” Later, after a mistake, she added, “I wish I had known earlier about the new deadline.” Durante a revisão do projeto, Maria disse: “Eu já fiz isso antes, então conheço os passos.” Seu colega respondeu: “Eu já trabalhei em projetos semelhantes, então posso ajudar.” Mais tarde, após um erro, ela acrescentou: “Eu gostaria que eu soubesse antes sobre o novo prazo.”

stories.title: Business Work General Vocabulary
stories.text: During the project meeting, the manager said, “We’re working on the new feature now. The issue was resolved yesterday, so we can move forward. I’d like to focus on the user interface before the launch. I’m looking forward to the client’s feedback.” Durante a reunião do projeto, o gerente disse: “Estamos trabalhando na nova funcionalidade agora. O problema foi resolvido ontem, então podemos avançar.

stories.title: Celebrations Expressions
stories.text: Maria and João have been planning their wedding anniversary for months. They decided to travel to Paris, where they will celebrate with a candlelit dinner and a stroll along the Seine. They are looking forward to the big day, hoping it will be a memorable experience for both of them. Maria e João têm planejado seu aniversário de casamento há meses. Eles decidiram viajar para Paris, onde vão celebrar com um jantar à luz de velas e uma caminhada ao longo do Sena. Eles estão ansiosos pela grande data, esperando que seja uma experiência memorável para ambos.

stories.title: Idiomatic Phrases General
stories.text: At the end of the day, we gathered to discuss the project. Last but not least, we thanked everyone for their hard work. She brought her laptop, but I had to take it to the office. The team ended up working late, and we solved problems on our own. No fim das contas, nos reunimos para discutir o projeto. Por fim, mas não menos importante, agradecemos a todos pelo trabalho duro.

stories.title: Instead General Vocabulary
stories.text: Instead of spending the weekend at home, Maria decided to visit her grandparents. She packed a bag, took the train, and arrived early. The family welcomed her with a warm hug and a homemade dinner. Maria felt grateful for the unexpected adventure. Em vez de passar o fim de semana em casa, Maria decidiu visitar os avós.

stories.title: Likewise General Vocabulary
stories.text: I enjoy hiking in the mountains. Likewise, my friend loves exploring trails and discovering new views.

stories.title: Tasty Tasteless
stories.text: When I visited the local market, I tried a new soup. It looked delicious, but the first bite was surprisingly bland. I told the vendor that it was tasty and tasteless, a strange combination that left me puzzled.

stories.title: Lol And Laugh Out Loud
stories.text: In modern texting, people often use abbreviations like lol to express laughter quickly. While some may think it is informal, it is widely accepted in casual conversations. When you see someone write "lol" after a joke, they are indicating that they found it funny. On the other hand, "laugh out loud" is a full phrase that can be used in both spoken and written English to describe a strong laugh. No texto moderno, as pessoas costumam usar abreviações como lol para expressar risadas rapidamente. Embora alguns possam achar que é informal, ele é amplamente aceito em conversas casuais.

stories.title: Desire Itch Everything Else
stories.text: When I think about my future, I feel that itch to explore new cultures. I wish I could travel more, but my schedule is tight. Still, I have a true desire to learn languages, and I plan to start with Spanish next month.

stories.title: Keep Principles Respectful
stories.text: In many cultures, people emphasize the importance of keeping principles. Christian principles, such as love and honesty, guide individuals in both personal and professional settings. Even when the topic is not religious, it is essential to act respectfully and uphold these values. Em muitas culturas, as pessoas enfatizam a importância de manter princípios. Princípios cristãos, como amor e honestidade, orientam os indivíduos tanto em situações pessoais quanto profissionais.

stories.title: U Haul Behind Hearse
stories.text: During the move, the family decided to rent a U-Haul truck. They packed their furniture and boxes, then drove to the coast. On the way, they passed a funeral procession. The driver joked that he would never see a U-Haul behind a hearse, but the family laughed and continued their journey.

stories.title: Daily Routine Health
stories.text: Every morning, I get out of bed early, take a shower, and get ready for school. After class, I sometimes step out for a quick walk. If I get a cut while shaving, I use aftershave to soothe the skin. I always keep my grown facial hair trimmed and my hands clean. Todas as manhãs, eu acordo e saio da cama cedo, tomo um banho e me preparo para a escola. Depois da aula, às vezes saio para uma caminhada rápida. Se eu me cortar enquanto me barbeio, uso aftershave para acalmar a pele.

stories.title: Bring Take Get Give Regard However
stories.text: I bring my notebook to class, take notes, get feedback, and give my homework to the teacher. She regards my effort as impressive. However, she says I need to practice more.

stories.title: Candles Home Items
stories.text: Candles have been used for centuries to provide light and create a warm atmosphere. In many cultures, candles symbolize hope, celebration, and remembrance. When you light a candle, the flame melts the wax, producing a gentle glow that can calm the mind. Velas têm sido usadas há séculos para fornecer luz e criar uma atmosfera acolhedora. Em muitas culturas, velas simbolizam esperança, celebração e lembrança.

stories.title: Idioms Expressions English
stories.text: During the team meeting, the manager decided to break the ice by sharing a funny story. Everyone laughed, and the atmosphere became relaxed. Later, Sarah hit the nail on the head when she pointed out the main issue. The team felt under the weather after a long day, but they managed to finish the project. It was a piece of cake for the new members.

stories.title: Forever Although Lastbutnotleast
stories.text: I promised my friend that I would stay by her side forever. Although the road was long, we kept walking. Last but not least, we celebrated our journey with a small cake. Prometi ao meu amigo que eu ficaria ao seu lado para sempre. Embora o caminho fosse longo, continuamos caminhando. Por último, mas não menos importante, celebramos nossa jornada com um pequeno bolo.

stories.title: .Trashed 1769699738 202512301133 Even Though Expressions
stories.text: Even though the city was crowded, the park remained a peaceful oasis. People walked slowly, enjoying the quiet, even though the traffic outside was noisy.

stories.title: Business Work General Vocab
stories.text: During the meeting, the manager said, "Yes, I'll give an example" to illustrate the new policy. Then she asked, "Wait a moment, please," as she prepared the slides. Afterward, she added, "Do you add the question in English, then in Dutch?" to confirm the bilingual format. Finally, she concluded, "Hopefully, all our efforts will pay off." Durante a reunião, o gerente disse, "Sim, eu vou dar um exemplo" para ilustrar a nova política. Depois, ele pediu, "Espere um momento, por favor," enquanto preparava os slides. Em seguida, ele acrescentou, "Você adiciona a pergunta em inglês, depois em holandês?" para confirmar o formato bilíngue. Por fim, ele concluiu, "Esperançosamente, todos os nossos esforços darão resultado."

stories.title: Pray Brings So That
stories.text: During the quiet evening, Maria decided to pray for her family's health. She brought a small candle to the altar, hoping it would bring peace. She also told her friend that she would leave early, so that she could finish her work on time.

stories.title: General Vocabulary Expressions
stories.text: During the meeting, the manager said, "I think we can keep aligning our goals." Everyone nodded, and the team decided to step back and review the plan. After the discussion, the project arrived at a new stage, and the team celebrated a lazy day at home.

stories.title: In A Hurry Greeting Confused
stories.text: Maria was in a hurry to catch the train. She had a meeting at 9 a.m. and didn’t want to be late. On the way, she got confused by the new subway map and asked a stranger for help. After a few minutes, she found her platform and greeted the conductor with a smile. Maria estava com pressa para pegar o trem.

stories.title: Hug Practice Variation
stories.text: Yesterday, the train has arrived at the station. I gave my friend a hug when I saw him. He was willing to practice English with me. We decided to vary our routine by playing chess, just to vary. The news had a cover story about a homeless man who found a new home. It was funny how the story made everyone laugh, and we had fun reading it. Ontem, o trem chegou à estação.

stories.title: General Business Health Vocabulary
stories.text: I built a small garden in my backyard from scratch. I invite my friends to come and we get along well. We talk about what are their jobs and what is their job. Next one we will try a new vitamin supplement.

stories.title: Food Cooking Menu Phrases
stories.text: You walk into a cozy café and ask the waiter, "May we sit at this table?" He smiles and says, "Sure, please have a seat." Then you ask, "Can I see the menu?" He hands you a paper with dishes. You look at it and ask, "What's on the menu today?" Você entra em um café aconchegante e pergunta ao garçom, "Posso sentar-me nesta mesa?" Ele sorri e diz, "Claro, sente-se." Depois, você pergunta, "Posso ver o cardápio?" Ele entrega um papel com pratos. Você olha e pergunta, "O que há no cardápio hoje?"

stories.title: Food Ordering Spicy
stories.text: At the restaurant, you can say, "I'll have the steak, please," and later ask, "Is it spicy?" If you want more, say, "Could I have another salad, please?" When finished, ask, "May I have the check, please?" No restaurante, você pode dizer: "Eu gostaria do bife, por favor," e depois perguntar: "Está picante?" Se quiser mais, diga: "Poderia me trazer outra salada, por favor?" Quando terminar, peça: "Posso receber a conta, por favor?"

stories.title: Wired Energetic State
stories.text: When you are wired, you feel a surge of energy that can help you focus. Many people use caffeine to get wired before a big presentation. However, being wired for too long can lead to burnout.

stories.title: Perfume General Vocabulary
stories.text: Perfume has been a part of human culture for thousands of years. Ancient Egyptians used it in religious rituals, while modern people wear it to express their personality. A good perfume can boost confidence and leave a lasting impression. O perfume faz parte da cultura humana há milhares de anos. Os antigos egípcios o usavam em rituais religiosos, enquanto os modernos o usam para expressar sua personalidade. Um bom perfume pode aumentar a confiança e deixar uma impressão duradoura.

stories.title: Yawned Bike Going
stories.text: On a sunny Saturday, I decided to go to the beach. I packed my bike, a towel, and a sandwich. While riding, I felt the wind and the sand between my toes. After a while, I yawned loudly because the day was long and relaxing. Em um sábado ensolarado, decidi ir à praia.

stories.title: Kkk Onomatopoeia Expressions
stories.text: In English-speaking online communities, people often use 'Kkk' to show laughter. It is similar to the Portuguese 'kkkk' and is usually typed after a funny comment or meme. While it adds a casual tone, it should be avoided in formal contexts. Em comunidades online de falantes de inglês, as pessoas costumam usar 'Kkk' para mostrar risadas. É semelhante ao 'kkkk' em português e geralmente é digitado após um comentário ou meme engraçado. Embora adicione um tom casual, deve ser evitado em contextos formais.

stories.title: General Phrasal Emotions Vocabulary
stories.text: After the meeting, I will attend to the emails. Afterwards, we will go to the park. Everything else is amazing, especially the new coffee shop. He was in a cheerful mood, which made everyone smile. Depois da reunião, eu vou atender aos e-mails. Depois disso, iremos ao parque. Tudo o que há de mais é incrível, especialmente a nova cafeteria.

stories.title: Not To Brag Expressions
stories.text: Many people use the phrase 'not to brag' when they want to show humility. It signals that they are not trying to impress others. For example, someone might say, 'I finished the marathon, not to brag, but I'm proud of myself.' Muitas pessoas usam a expressão 'not to brag' quando querem demonstrar humildade.

stories.title: To Brag Phrasal Verbs
stories.text: Bragging is a common way people share their successes. Some people love to brag about their new gadgets, while others prefer to brag about their cooking skills. However, bragging can sometimes come across as boastful if not done carefully. Se gabar é uma maneira comum de as pessoas compartilharem seus sucessos. Algumas pessoas adoram se gabar de seus novos gadgets, enquanto outras preferem se gabar de suas habilidades culinárias. No entanto, se gabar pode às vezes parecer presunçoso se não for feito com cuidado.

stories.title: Brag Express Pride
stories.text: Many people love to brag about their successes, but it can sometimes make others feel uncomfortable. It is important to balance confidence with humility, especially in professional settings. Muitas pessoas gostam de se gabar de suas conquistas, mas isso pode deixar os outros desconfortáveis. É importante equilibrar a confiança com a humildade, especialmente em ambientes profissionais.

stories.title: Surgery Take Care Health
stories.text: After the surgery, the patient was advised to take care of herself by resting, eating healthy foods, and following the doctor's instructions. Após a cirurgia, o paciente foi orientado a cuidar de si mesmo descansando, comendo alimentos saudáveis e seguindo as instruções do médico.

stories.title: English Slang Words
stories.text: Slang is a lively part of English. It changes quickly and can vary by region. Knowing slang helps you understand movies, music, and everyday conversations. Gíria é uma parte viva do inglês.

stories.title: Whether Walk Beach
stories.text: I walk along the beach every morning, listening to the waves. I wonder whether the tide will bring new shells today. The quiet of the sea makes me think about whether I should stay or leave the city.

stories.title: Inadequate Unaffordable Brag
stories.text: The new office building was praised for its modern design, but many employees found the furniture inadequate for long meetings. Additionally, the rent was unaffordable for small startups. Some managers tried to brag about their success, but the lack of resources made it difficult. O novo prédio de escritórios foi elogiado por seu design moderno, mas muitos funcionários acharam os móveis inadequados para reuniões longas. Além disso, o aluguel era inacessível para pequenas startups. Alguns gerentes tentaram se gabar de seu sucesso, mas a falta de recursos dificultou.

stories.title: Persistent Determination
stories.text: Persistence is a key quality for success. When you face challenges, staying persistent helps you find solutions and reach your goals. A persistência é uma qualidade fundamental para o sucesso.

stories.title: Developer Tough Proudly
stories.text: I have worked as a developer for more than 12 years. I have been a developer since 2013. I proudly display my achievements and I love to brag about my projects. The tough challenges in the .NET world keep me motivated.

stories.title: Persistent Effort And Work Experience
stories.text: I have been working as a developer since 2012. During this time, I worked at many companies and gained diverse experience. My most work is as a .NET consultant, and I have also worked extensively as a SharePoint developer. I graduated from university with a degree in Systems Analysis and Development, and I am currently in my postgraduate (MBA) program, studying solution architecture.
